The previously described method by Mascolo et al. [ 49] was used to carry gastro-intestinal motility experiment. The treatment was followed as described in the castor oil-induced diarrhoea test. Charcoal feed was prepared by mixing 10% charcoal with 5% gum-acacia and after 1 h of administration of the sample, 1 mL charcoal feed was given orally to each animal. After 1 h of application of charcoal, the mice were forgone and the length (cm) moved by the charcoal feed from the pylorus to caecum was recorded.
